attack_rolls.description: Make a d20 roll + ability modifier + proficiency bonus (if proficient) vs target's AC
attack_rolls.critical_hit: Natural 20 hits automatically and deals maximum weapon damage + extra damage dice
attack_rolls.advantage: Roll two d20s and take the higher result
attack_rolls.disadvantage: Roll two d20s and take the lower result

damage_rolls.description: Roll weapon damage dice + ability modifier
damage_rolls.critical_damage: Roll damage dice twice and add modifiers once

saving_throws.description: d20 + ability modifier + proficiency bonus (if proficient) vs DC
saving_throws.death_saves: Three failures = death, three successes = stable at 0 HP
saving_throws.common_dcs: Easy DC 10, Medium DC 15, Hard DC 20, Very Hard DC 25

skill_checks.description: d20 + ability modifier + proficiency bonus (if proficient) vs DC
skill_checks.advantage_situations: Help action, favorable circumstances, proper tools

spellcasting.spell_attack: d20 + spellcasting ability modifier + proficiency bonus vs AC
spellcasting.concentration: Constitution save when taking damage, DC = 10 or half damage (whichever is higher)
spellcasting.components: Verbal (V), Somatic (S), Material (M) - need free hand for S/M components
spellcasting.spell_slots: Expended when casting, regained on long rest (unless specified otherwise)

combat_actions.action: Attack, Cast a Spell, Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, Hide, Ready, Search, Use an Object
combat_actions.bonus_action: Some spells, off-hand attacks, class features - only one per turn
combat_actions.movement: Move up to your speed, can split movement before/after actions
combat_actions.reaction: Opportunity attacks, some spells, class features - only one per round

initiative.description: d20 + Dexterity modifier, act in descending order
initiative.surprise: Surprised creatures cannot move or take actions on first turn
initiative.ready_action: Choose trigger and action, occurs on trigger using your reaction

conditions.blinded: Cannot see, attacks have disadvantage, attacks against you have advantage
conditions.charmed: Cannot attack charmer, charmer has advantage on social interactions
conditions.frightened: Disadvantage on ability checks and attacks while source is in sight
conditions.grappled: Speed becomes 0, ends if grappler is incapacitated or moved away
conditions.paralyzed: Incapacitated, cannot move or speak, auto-fail Str and Dex saves, attacks within 5ft are crits
conditions.poisoned: Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks
conditions.prone: Disadvantage on attacks, attacks within 5ft have advantage, ranged attacks have disadvantage
conditions.restrained: Speed 0, disadvantage on attacks and Dex saves, attacks against have advantage
conditions.stunned: Incapacitated, cannot move, auto-fail Str and Dex saves
conditions.unconscious: Incapacitated, prone, drop held items, auto-fail Str and Dex saves, attacks within 5ft are crits

resting.short_rest: 1 hour rest, regain hit dice usage, some class features
resting.long_rest: 8 hour rest, regain all HP and spell slots, regain half total hit dice
resting.benefits: Remove exhaustion levels, some class features reset

advantage_disadvantage.advantage_sources: Help action, flanking (optional), favorable conditions, some spells/abilities
advantage_disadvantage.disadvantage_sources: Attacking while prone, attacking beyond range, some conditions
advantage_disadvantage.cancellation: Any amount of advantage + any amount of disadvantage = straight roll

armor_class.calculation: Base AC + Dex modifier (max based on armor type)

hit_points.calculation: Hit Die per level + Constitution modifier per level
hit_points.temporary_hp: Do not stack, take the higher amount, lost first before real HP
